description: Pops into a minibuffer for evaluating expressions.  Useful for navigating emacs' twisty elisp stuffs.
name: eval-minibuffer

description: list all bindings
name: descbinds

description: Kill buffer by name.  Prompts for input.
name: kill-buffer

description: Kill from point to end of sentence.
name: kill-sentence

description: Regex search through previous minibuffer history
name: regexp for minibuffer history

description: Find the next example of word under cursor.
name: goto next

description: If you set the incsearch option, Vim will show the first match for the pattern, while you are still typing it
name: incsearch

description: Jump to matching closing brace.
name: jump-to-brace

description: Each triggers a command to go forwards `]` or backwards `[` by things like closing parens and marks.
name: adv. move

description: Move > or <, by block.
name: jump-block

description: Repeat last command (like change-word)
name: repeat-last-change

description: Start recording into <register>
name: record-macro

description: Playback macro at <register>
name: play-macro

description: description goes here
name: grep-files

description: Indent the region
name: indent-region

description: Prefix for a bunch of window-based commands, like rotation, balancing, moving, focusing, splitting, etc.
name: evil-window-prefix

description: open a traversible tree of undo information
name: undo-tree-visualize

description: go to next error.
name: next-error

description: Activate  any of a series of super handy helm commands
name: helm-prefix

description: Sets the mark.  See documentation on set-mark for more info
name: set mark

description: Use any of a number of version control commands, like diff, push, pull, etc
name: vc-preix

description: Find where <thing under="" point="">thing-under-point is defined.  Use liberally.</thing>
name: xref-find-definitions

description: Powerful tool that finds references of thing-under-point<thing under="" point=""></thing>
name: xref-find-references

description: Execute a command, but limit the autofill to commands relevant to the current buffer.
name: execute extended command for buffer

description: Move by 'sentence' - which can mean different things depending on the context.
name: backwards sentence / forwards sentence

description: move forwards or backwards by paragraph
name: move paragraph

description: Execute a shell command on region
name: shell-command-on-region

description: Find everything that looks like thing-under-point
name: xref-apropos

description: provides a set of 'narrows' that hide everything but something
name: narrowing prefix

note: Does not work with evil-region, unfortunately.
description: Search the web for thing in <region> and open a buffer with ddg results</region>
name: eww-search-words

description: sets selective display to <num>, collapsing everything with a lesser indent</num>
name: set selective-display

description: Take a screenshot.  Use SHIFT-APPLE-4 for a partial.  You will need to use the mouse.
name: screenshot
